recipeCategories.name: Cookies
recipeCategories.description: Drop cookies, cut-out cookies, bar cookies

flourRecommendations.name: Gluten-Free 1:1 Blend
tips: Measure flour by weight (1 cup = 120g) for best results
No additional binders needed - blend includes xanthan gum
Mix dry ingredients thoroughly before adding wet ingredients
Let cookies cool on pan for 2-3 minutes before removing
Store in airtight container - they stay fresh for 5-7 days
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: Best for beginners and when you want guaranteed results

flourRecommendations.name: Almond Flour
tips: Measure by weight (1 cup = 96g) - almond flour is lighter than wheat flour
Add 1/4 tsp xanthan gum per cup and mix with dry ingredients first
Reduce sugar by 1/4 cup - almond flour adds natural sweetness
Bake at 25°F lower temperature to prevent over-browning
Cookies will be slightly chewier and more dense than wheat flour cookies
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: When you want nutty flavor and don't mind denser texture

flourRecommendations.name: Coconut Flour
tips: Use 1/4 the amount of wheat flour (1/4 cup coconut flour = 1 cup wheat flour)
Add 1 extra egg per 1/4 cup flour for binding and moisture
Let batter rest 5 minutes before baking to allow absorption
Bake at 25°F lower temperature - coconut flour browns quickly
Test doneness with toothpick - coconut flour can be tricky to judge
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: When you want high-fiber cookies with coconut flavor

recipeCategories.name: Bread
recipeCategories.description: Sandwich bread, artisan bread, dinner rolls

flourRecommendations.name: Gluten-Free Bread Flour
tips: Measure flour by weight (1 cup = 120g) for accuracy
Mix 1 tsp xanthan gum with dry ingredients before adding liquids
Let dough rise in 75-80°F place for 45-60 minutes until doubled
Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes until internal temp reaches 200°F
Let cool completely before slicing to prevent crumbling
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: Best for sandwich bread and dinner rolls

flourRecommendations.name: Custom Flour Blend
tips: Mix: 40% rice flour, 30% sorghum, 20% starch, 10% protein flour
Add 1 tsp xanthan gum per cup and mix thoroughly with dry ingredients
Let dough rest 30 minutes before shaping to allow hydration
Use bread machine or stand mixer on low speed for 3-4 minutes
Shape gently - gluten-free dough is more fragile than wheat dough
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: When you want full control and are willing to experiment

flourRecommendations.name: Gluten-Free 1:1 Blend
tips: Measure flour by weight (1 cup = 120g) for consistent results
Mix dry ingredients well to distribute xanthan gum evenly
Don't overmix batter - mix just until combined to avoid dense cake
Let cool completely before frosting - warm cake will melt frosting
Store covered at room temperature for 2-3 days or refrigerate for 5-7 days
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: Best for beginners and when you want guaranteed results

flourRecommendations.name: Almond Flour
tips: Use same amount as wheat flour
Add 1/4 tsp xanthan gum per cup
Reduce sugar by 1/4 cup
Bake at 25°F lower temperature
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: When you want moist, dense cake with nutty flavor

flourRecommendations.name: Gluten-Free Pizza Flour
tips: Use same amount as wheat flour
Add 1 tsp xanthan gum per cup
Let dough rest 30 minutes
Roll between parchment paper

flourRecommendations.name: Custom Flour Blend
tips: Mix: 50% rice flour, 25% sorghum, 25% starch
Add 1 tsp xanthan gum per cup
Let dough rest 30 minutes
Use wet hands to shape
flourRecommendations.whenToUse: When you want full control and are willing to experiment

Fill muffin cups 3/4 full
